{{MessageBox | Message = This page merges many beings sometimes believed to be the same entity, and could be split in the future depending on the publication of new material ([[Talk:{{PAGENAME}}|Discuss]]).[[Category:Possible Separate Pages]] }} {{Marvel Database:Team Template | Image = No Image Available At All.png | Title = Black Gods of R'Lyeh / [[Black Gods]] | Name = Black Gods of [[R'Lyeh]]{{r|{{cl|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1}}; [[Demons]]' profile}} / [[Black Gods]]{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #14|; A Kull Glossary: Black Gods' profile}} ''([[{{PAGENAME}}#Notes|see notes]])'' | EditorialNames = | Aliases = | Status = | Identity = Secret | Reality = Earth-616 | BaseOfOperations = [[R'lyeh (City)|R'Lyeh]] | Leaders = | CurrentMembers = | FormerMembers = | Allies = | Enemies = | Origin = [[Great Old Ones|Great]] or [[Lesser Old Ones]] | PlaceOfFormation = | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Robert E. Howard; Roy Thomas | First = Savage Sword of Conan #16 | First2 = (Referenced){{r|{{cl|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1}}; [[Demons]]' profile}} | Last = | HistoryText = ===Origins=== The '''Black Gods of [[R'lyeh (City)|R'Lyeh]]''' were either [[Great Old Ones|Great]] or [[Lesser Old Ones]],{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 3|; [[Demons]]' profile}} presumably originating and/or dwelling in [[R'lyeh (City)|R'lyeh]], one of the cities built in elder times by the [[Great Old Ones]].{{r|King in Black: Namor #2}} ===[[Pre-Cataclysmic Age]]=== Circa 18,500 BC, the '''Black Gods''' were invoked on the island of [[Atlantis (Empire)|Atlantis]].{{r|Kull the Destroyer #18|; The Keeper of Flame and Frost!}}{{r|Kull the Destroyer #21|; City of the Crawling Dead}}{{r|Kull the Destroyer #24|; Screams in the Dark}}{{r|Kull the Destroyer #26|; Into Death's Dimension!}}
''It is unknown if those "Black Gods" are indeed the Black Gods of R'lyeh ([[{{PAGENAME}}#Notes|see notes]])''.[[Category:Atlantean Deities]] ===[[Hyborian Age]]=== Circa 10,000 BC, to avenge himself from [[Lupus Dalvalte (Earth-616)|Captain Dalvalte]] who tortured him, left him for dead and stole his daughters, [[Reimos (Earth-616)|Reimos]] allegedly entered in contact with the Old Ones, the Black Gods of R'Lyeh, the [[Shub-Niggurath (Earth-616)|Goat with a Thousand Young]] and the children of [[Cthulhu (Earth-616)|Great Cthulhu]], who offered him his spider-infested castle.{{r|Conan the Barbarian #141|; The Web Tightens}} ===200 A.D.=== Circa 200 A.D., the Black Gods of R'Lyeh were sometimes invoked (though reluctantly) in [[Roman Empire|Roman]]-invaded [[Britain|Pictland]].{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #16|; Worms of the Earth}} | Equipment = | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = * The [[Black Gods of R'lyeh]] were created by [[Robert E. Howard|Robert E. Howard]] in "[[Worms of the Earth]]" (''[[Weird Tales]]''; November, 1932), adapted in [[Marvel Comics]] in {{cl|Savage Sword of Conan #16}} (December, 1976) and {{cl|Savage Sword of Conan #17|#17}} (February, 1977). [[R'lyeh (City)|R'lyeh]] was created by [[Howard Phillips Lovecraft|H.P. Lovecraft]] in "Call of Cthulhu" (''Weird Tales''; June, 1928). ** It is possible that the Black Gods of R'lyeh, instead of being a subset of the [[Great Old Ones|Great]] or [[Lesser Old Ones]], were originally meant simply as a synonyms for the Great Old Ones, but were considered a proper group by the Official Handbooks writer after being invoked alongside the Old Ones and other entities in "The Web Tightens" ({{cl|Conan the Barbarian #141}}; December, 1982). * The "Black Gods" of the [[Pre-Cataclysmic Age]] were mentioned by Robert E. Howard in "[[The Curse of the Golden Skull]]"{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #14|; A Kull Glossary: Black Gods' profile}} (1928), adapted in {{cl|Conan the Barbarian #37}} (April, 1974). The Black Gods aren't mentioned in that adaptation. ** "Black Gods" were mentioned in {{cl|Kull the Destroyer #18}}, {{cl|Kull the Destroyer #21|#21}}, {{cl|Kull the Destroyer #24|#24}}, and {{cl|Kull the Destroyer #26|#26}} (December, 1976 to April, 1978). * It is unknown if the [[Thing from R'lyeh (Earth-616)|Thing from R'lyeh]], an Old One, was part of the [[Black Gods of R'Lyeh]], Old Ones (Lesser or Great) as well. | Trivia = * R'lyeh was originally wrote with a "l" minuscule letter. In comics, it is unknown how it is written (due to bubble texts being written exclusively in capital letters), but in the [[Demons]]' profile of {{cl|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities}}, it is written "R'Lyeh", with a capital "L". | Links = }} [[Category:Deities]] [[Category:Cthulhu Mythos Races, Species and Groups]] [[Category:Great Old Ones]] [[Category:Lesser Old Ones]] [[Category:Pre-Cataclysmic Age Characters]] [[Category:Pre-Cataclysmic Age Deities]] [[Category:Hyborian Age Characters]] [[Category:Hyborian Age Deities]] [[Category:Literary Characters]] [[Category:Black Gods]]
